abstract: Qassiarsuk Journal; residents of Greenland's Kujalleq municipality weigh economic benefits of proposed mining operations against threat to their traditional rural lifestyle of farming and fishing; vast, sparsely populated area has long been on tentative list to be designated Unesco World Heritage site but 2013 changes to country's mining regulations have prompted numerous proposals from companies who hope to explore rich deposits of minerals.
lead_paragraph: As the territory pushes forward with plans to mine its vast deposits of resources, many citizens fear their farming and fishing culture could be disrupted.

headline.main: Greenland’s Farmers Torn Over Tapping Pristine Land for Mineral Riches
headline.print_headline: In Greenland, Farmers Torn Over Mining for Minerals

snippet: As the territory pushes forward with plans to mine its vast deposits of resources, many citizens fear their farming and fishing culture could be disrupted.

keywords.value: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
keywords.name: organizations
